filters.name: QMOF ID
filters.tooltip: Find materials with a specific QMOF ID, e.g. qmof-a2d95c3

filters.name: CSD Refcode
filters.tooltip: Find materials with a specific Cambridge Structural Database Refcode (case-sensitive)

filters.name: MOFkey
filters.tooltip: Find materials with a specific MOFkey generated using the MOFid tool

filters.name: Number of Atoms
filters.tooltip: Number of atoms per simulation unit cell

filters.name: Include Elements
filters.tooltip: List of chemical elements in the structure, delineated by '-' and listed in alphabetical order.

filters.name: Formula
filters.tooltip: Enter an empirical (i.e. reduced) chemical formula with the elements in alphabetical order to find materials that have this exact formula. Use the "*" symbol to specify a wildcard element.

props.errorMessage: Please enter a valid chemical formula (e.g. Zn4C24H12O13).

filters.name: Inorganic Node
filters.tooltip: SMILES string of the inorganic node(s) determined from MOFid. Multiple nodes should be separated by commas in alphabetical order. Supports partial string matches. Note that not all materials have a computable MOFid.

filters.name: Organic Linker
filters.tooltip: SMILES string of the organic linker(s) determined from MOFid. Multiple linkers should be separated by commas in alphabetical order. Supports partial string matches. Note that not all materials have a computable MOFid.

filters.name: Topology
filters.tooltip: Reticular Chemistry Structure Resource (RCSR) Topology code detected from MOFid. Note that not all materials have a computable MOFid.

filters.name: Structure Database
filters.tooltip: The source database for the material. Refer to the documentation for full details.

filters.name: Reference DOI
filters.tooltip: The DOI (e.g. 10.1021/jp103212z) for the source reference of the material. Supports partial matches to allow for journal-based queries.

filters.name: From Experimental Database
filters.tooltip: Materials that were taken from the experimental crystal structure databases are considered to be synthesized. While other materials were taken from so-called hypothetical databases, note that this does not necessarily exclude the possibility that they too can be experimentally synthesized.

filters.name: Pore-limiting Diameter
filters.tooltip: The smallest spherical diameter of void space that a guest species would need to traverse in order to diffuse through the material

filters.name: Largest Cavity Diameter
filters.tooltip: The largest spherical diameter that can fit within the void space of the material

filters.name: Density
filters.tooltip: Mass density

filters.name: Volume
filters.tooltip: Volume of the simulation unit cell

filters.name: Space Group Symbol
filters.tooltip: The space group symbol for the lattice

filters.name: Space Group Number
filters.tooltip: The space group number for the lattice

filters.name: Crystal System
filters.tooltip: The crystal system for the lattice

filters.name: Band Gap - PBE
filters.tooltip: Band gap calculated with the PBE-D3(BJ) GGA functional. Note that this level of theory tends to underpredict band gaps.

filters.name: Band Gap - HLE17
filters.tooltip: Band gap calculated with the PBE-D3(BJ) GGA functional. Note that this level of theory tends to underpredict band gaps.

filters.name: Band Gap - HSE06*
filters.tooltip: Band gap calculated with the HSE06 screened hybrid functional and 10% Hartree-Fock exchange (using the PBE-D3(BJ) structure). It tends to be more accurate than PBE and HLE17. It will generally predict lower band gaps than HSE06, which can be ideal for some materials.

filters.name: Band Gap - HSE06
filters.tooltip: Band gap calculated with the HSE06 screened hybrid functional and 25% Hartree-Fock exchange (using the PBE-D3(BJ) structure). It tends to be more accurate than PBE and HLE17. It will generally predict higher band gaps than HSE06*.

filters.name: Max Partial Charge
filters.tooltip: Maximum DDEC6 partial atomic charge at the PBE-D3(BJ) level of theory

filters.name: Total Magnetization
filters.tooltip: Total number of unpaired electrons per unit cell calculated at the PBE-D3(BJ) level of theory

filters.name: Max Magnetic Moment
filters.tooltip: Maximum (absolute) atomic magnetic moment at the PBE-D3(BJ) level of theory

filters.name: Max Atomic Spin Moment
filters.tooltip: Maximum (absolute) atomic spin moment calculated via the DDEC6 method at the PBE-D3(BJ) level of theory
